an3.56:1.1: Then a well-to-do Brahmin went up to the Buddha, and seated to one side he said to him:
an3.56:1.2: “Master Gotama, I have heard that brahmins of the past who were elderly and senior, the teachers of teachers, said:
an3.56:1.3: ‘In the old days this world was as crowded as hell, just full of people. The villages, towns and capital cities were no more than a chicken’s flight apart.’
an3.56:1.4: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled, a decline in population is evident, and whole villages, towns, cities, and countries have disappeared?”
an3.56:2.1: “These days, brahmin, humans just love illicit desire. They’re overcome by immoral greed, and mired in wrong thoughts.
an3.56:2.2: Taking up sharp knives, they murder each other. And so many people perish.
an3.56:2.3: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.
an3.56:3.1: Furthermore, because these days humans just love illicit desire …
an3.56:3.2: the heavens don’t provide enough rain,
an3.56:3.3: so there’s famine, a bad harvest, with blighted crops that turn to straw.
an3.56:3.5: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.
an3.56:4.1: Furthermore, because these days humans just love illicit desire …
an3.56:4.2: native spirits let vicious monsters loose. And so many people perish.
an3.56:4.3: This is the cause, this is the reason why these days human numbers have dwindled.”
an3.56:5.2: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
